job_title: Academic Tutor in Crestview Hills, KY
pros: This school is a true community where you will get to know people and build strong networks. Flexibility and appreciation abound. This is a place where people are truly invested in academics and learning.
cons: Salary and benefits could be better, but the company culture makes it worth it.

pros: I worked as a peer tutor in the tutoring center and ILD. My supervisors were kind and communicated well, and scheduling was always flexible.
cons: All work studies get paid $8/hr which is simply too low. I struggled to pay for gas when it was $5/gal a few months ago. Not to mention, I was the only tutor for my major and could not fulfill the high demand for tutoring alone. They did not find a replacement when I left and I suspect this is because of low pay rates.

job_title: Enrollment Coach in Crestview Hills, KY
pros: Nice people, generous tuition remission policy, small community feel, good location, great holiday schedule
Loved the people I worked with- that is it.
cons: - No room for advancement - Underpaid- I couldn't afford to live on my own - The administration does not care about you and your well-being - Departments are siloed - No support from the higher-ups - Not enough support for the students

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Crestview Hills, KY
pros: Thomas More University has an incredible group of students as well as Faculty and Staff! For a small Catholic University, the location is extremely safe and convenient. The benefits are good if you need them.
cons: It is a trade-off. Salary or fulfilling and meaningful work. If you love it, you find a way to make it all work out. At the end of the day, you have the opportunity to make an impact on the students’ futures and making it to the Finish Line!

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Crestview Hills, SC
pros: Flexible work environment. Younger enrollment counselors makes for a laid back work environment.
cons: Low pay and upper level management has the mentality of "You're replaceable. We can always hire younger and cheaper." Management had favorites which was very obvious. New management was all about change but the faculty wasn't on board, leading the admissions department stuck in the middle.

pros: Professionally rewarding; mission oriented; caring environment for staff; progressive
cons: Higher education pay is lower than the private sector

job_title: Student Ambassador in Crestview Hills, KY
pros: The work study positions is works around your class hours and the environment is very supportive.
cons: I have no Cons to speak of
